<<<<<<< HEAD
Praxis medicinæ reformata: = or, The practice of physick reformed Being an epitome of the whole art: wherein is briefly shewed, the true causes, signs, prognosticks, and cure, of most diseases. Published for the benefit of all persons. By Robert Johnson, Med. Professor. Johnson, Robert, b. 1640?
[6], xxii, [4], 203, [1], 204, [1], 205-317, [7] p. : ill. (port)
printed for Brabazon Aylmer, at the Three Pigeons, in Cornhil, London : 1700.
With engraved frontispiece. Text is continuous despite pagination. An additional leaf of text numbered 204 on recto appears to be tipped in between leaves O6 and O7. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Praxis medicinæ reformata: = or, The practice of physick reformed Being an epitome of the whole art: wherein is briefly shewed, the true causes, signs, prognosticks, and cure, of most diseases. Published for the benefit of all persons. By Robert Johnson, Med. Professor. Johnson, Robert, b. 1640?
[6], xxii, [4], 203, [1], 204, [1], 205-317, [7] p. : ill. (port)
printed for Brabazon Aylmer, at the Three Pigeons, in Cornhil, London : 1700.
With engraved frontispiece. Text is continuous despite pagination. An additional leaf of text numbered 204 on recto appears to be tipped in between leaves O6 and O7. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Brabazon Aylmer
the Three Pigeons, in Cornhil
